channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: RFK Jr. and Dr. Oz to announce moves to ban gender-affirming care for young people
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is expected to announce a package of measures that would together ban gender-affirming care for minors. A press...

item.title: Could international troops be sent to Gaza? Here's why Trump's plan hinges on it
item.description: President Trump's peace plan for Gaza hinges on international troops in Gaza, but Israel is skeptical and no country has yet agreed to send their sold...

item.title: Takeaways from Trump's address. And, some GOP lawmakers shift stance on ACA subsidies
item.description: During a nationwide address, President Trump says the U.S. is poised for an economic boom. And, some Republican lawmakers joined Democrats to force a ...

item.title: Inflation cools slightly in November as worries about affordability grip Americans
item.description: The cost of living in November was up 2.7% from a year ago, according to a report Thursday from the Labor Department. That's a smaller annual increase...

item.title: New York has a new Archbishop. His background looks a lot like Pope Leo's
item.description: Like Pope Leo, Bishop Ronald Hicks is an Illinois native with deep experience in Latin America.

item.title: French 'Doctor Death' who poisoned patients jailed for life
item.description: A court finds Frédéric Péchier guilty of contaminating infusion bags with substances that caused cardiac arrest or hemorrhaging.

item.title: How the DOJ’s assault charges against protesters are crumbling inside courtrooms
item.description: The Justice Department has embarked on a monthslong effort to prosecute people accused of assaulting federal officers during protests of President Don...

item.title: Bit by bit, small US groups chip away at historic levels of social isolation
Teen inmate captured weeks after escaping prison with bedsheets
item.description: The inmate and another detainee fled an overcrowded jail after sawing through their cell bars with blades that investigators suspect were delivered by...

item.title: CPI report shows the inflation rate rose at a 2.7% pace in November
item.description: Economists had expected CPI to rise at an annual rate of 3% last month.

item.title: Small businesses face affordability crunch as tariff and other costs rise
item.description: Some small business owners say they're struggling to stay afloat because of higher tariff, health insurance and energy costs.

item.title: Trump Media to merge with nuclear fusion firm in $6bn deal
item.description: The company behind President Trump's Truth Social platform makes a surprising move into the energy sector.

item.title: Zelensky gives stark warning as EU leaders hold crunch talks on Russia's frozen assets
item.description: The EU is deciding whether to loan tens of billions of euros of Russian money to fund Ukraine's military and economic needs.

item.title: Peter Arnett, Pulitzer-winning war reporter, dies aged 91
item.description: He was known for covering the Vietnam and Gulf Wars - and for interviewing both Saddam Hussein and Osama bin Laden.

item.title: Timothy Dolan | 60 Minutes Archive
item.description: In 2011, 60 Minutes described Cardinal Timothy Dolan as "hard to miss" and a "tireless promoter of all things Catholic." He led more than two million ...

item.title: Peter Arnett, Pulitzer-winning war reporter, dies aged 91
item.description: He was known for covering the Vietnam and Gulf Wars - and for interviewing both Saddam Hussein and Osama bin Laden.

item.title: Brian Walshe sentenced to life in prison for "barbaric" murder
item.description: Brian Walshe was sentenced to life in prison for the murder of Ana Walshe after her sister gave a victim impact statement in court.

item.title: Pulitzer Prize-winning correspondent Peter Arnett, who reported on Vietnam and Gulf wars, has died
